intro: Atriplex amnicola, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit, which helps it conserve moisture and withstand harsh conditions. Atriplex amnicola is also known for its ability to stabilize soil and is sometimes used in restoration projects.
